title: Sanctuary
about: A friend of Mel’s was setting up a safe space at a festival early 2018 and Mel designed the main type for the space ‘sanctuary’ this is still a work in progress, and it is some experimentation into big type and how it works in big spaces.

title: Mandala
about: This was a piece of work I completed while living in Brisbane, and an early exploration into Geometry. I became facinated with geometry in around 2011 in my last year of university when I was exploring the ideas behind Junian Psychology and the way that symbols can be used to explore the subconscious.

title: Chaos
about: This is the biggest painting I have completed to date, it took about 12 months, and I used goache and pen. After hours and hours of painting this I spilt some of the paint on the image, not sure about what to do I sat there and stared at it for about 30 minutes. Knowing I had nothing to loose I decided to spill more paint on the image and experiemented with how I could use that. That element really added to the final product, and goes to show that mistakes are inevitable and have an amazing opportinuty to learn.

title: Stardust
about: Sketchbooks is a really important way for me to explore new ideas, express myself and learn more, its where I make a lot of mistakes, and a place that reminds me why I love drawing. I think its important to look at where people get to where they are and sketchbooks are a great way to show thoughts and processes.

title: The Misprint co.
about: In spring 2017 Mel entered a competition to win a guest artist spot at The Misprint Co. and managed to be the people's choice! The Misprint Co. is a small Wellington based company aimed at getting waste paper from sources around the region and repurposing them into something usable. With so much waste in the world its so great to see creative solutions to re-purpose rather than recycle Photography by Jenny Buckler. Check out their website misprint.co

title: Poi Creations
about: in 2015 a friend decided to start a small company making fabric poi, around this time I was heavily involved in the flow arts scene, doing performances at festivals around Australia, I was happy to help create a a logo and some visuals for their online presence.

title: EnSoul Mural
about: Mel moved out to the Kapiti Coast in June of 2017 to get some space and re group, while she was there she in collaboration with EnSoul Yoga Studio, painted a mural on their focal wall.As the first big mural this was an amazing experience for Mel and she learn so much about how to move into a different medium that she had wanted to for a while. The image was created specifically to fit into the emotive space that it was put into, and has had a really positive effect on the studio’s participants.

title: Kiwiburn Swag
about: Mel is currently the Chair of the Kiwiburn Arts Committee, this was a design she made to put on jumpers to give to her team to thank them for their support.

title: Lanterns
about: In 2017 Mel was approached by a friend creating an interactive art piece. The idea was to create lanterns that had programmable LED’s in them that lit up with sound and changed colour depending on the key of the sound.  Mel work alongside this project designing the lanterns to be able to be flat packable, and create an image to be laser cut to produce interesting and alluring shapes.

title: Colaborations
about: Mel loves working with other people and over the years and discovered how easy and interesting mandalas can be to collaborate with other people, and has spent a lot of time collaborating and inspiring people to explore this medium, here are a few mandala’s that were made in collaboration with other beautiful humans.

title: Leadlight
about: As you can probably tell Mel is very inspired by geometry and different ways of playing with that, and one of these explorations was with leadlighting.

title: One Nest
about: Two sisters came to me after seeing the geometric work I do to create a logo for a family business they started in 2017 making holistic natural remidies, they were amazing clients, and the aesthetic works really well with their nuturing home made feel.
